thread.title: Cwmbran roads still closed for pipe repairs after leak
thread.title_full: Cwmbran roads still closed for pipe repairs after leak - Worldnews.com

author: wn.com
title: Cwmbran roads still closed for pipe repairs after leak
text: Engineers have been unable to say how long it will take to repair a damaged gas pipe which has closed a number of roads in Cwmbran, Torfaen. Contractors accidentally severed the pipe on Thursday, causing a gas leak which led to the evacuation of the nearby Premier Inn and Ashbridge Inn. Avondale Road, Chapel Lane and Pontrhydyrun Road remain shut while work is carried out to repair the pipe. Wales & West Utilities said it could not say how long the work would take. A spokesperson said engineers had worked through the night and were working as quickly as possible to make the pipe safe. No gas supplies have been affected by the leak.
